title: Digital Environment Language Education Design Using Constructivist Approaches: Integrated Text, Speech, and Pragmatic Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced language learning and experience in high-level project execution (possessing foundational skills in academic writing, complex text comprehension, and formal speaking)
context.additional_context: Modular language education curriculum applying activity theory in smartphone-based LMS environments (integrating text/audio/video resources). Learners develop pragmatic competence through scenario-based language use (formal presentations, informal conversations, academic writing) with personalized feedback and peer evaluation

learning_goals: Learners will improve oral and written communication skills (pronunciation, intonation, sentence structure) by collaboratively solving tasks in mobile environments according to given scenarios

Learners will analyze real-life language issues (grammar error patterns, lexical context usage, pragmatic appropriateness) using digital tools (speech analyzers, vocabulary mapping tools) and propose constructivist solutions

Over 1â€“6 months, learners will correct over 80% of pronunciation, grammar, and expression errors using a weekly formative feedback system (automated grammar checks, pronunciation accuracy analysis) and achieve over 90 points (out of 100) in three consecutive monthly evaluations (integrated language proficiency tests) to improve language accuracy

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
